did.unittitle: Henkin, Leon and Tucker, Albert [Transcript no. 19]

scopecontent.p: Tucker and Henkin talk about John Addison, who became Alonzo Church's son-in-law. As an undergraduate at Princeton Addison became committed to mathematics as a result of taking Church's course in logic. Tucker tells how he helped bring it about that Addison did graduate work at the University of Wisconsin with Steve Kleene. The interviewer is William Aspray.
